prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: Do you enjoy reading articles about advancements in technology and science?
I do!
Are you interested in reading articles about politics and current events?
Sometimes, it depends on my mood
Do you like reading articles related to health and wellness?
Not really
Do you enjoy reading articles about arts and culture?
Depends on what the article is about, but often no
Are you interested in reading articles about sports and athletics?
Nah
Do you enjoy reading articles about travel and exploring different cultures?
Definitely!
Do you like reading articles about personal finance and investment strategies?
Yes!
Do you enjoy reading articles about food and cooking recipes?
Only if I'm looking up a specific recipe
Do you enjoy reading articles about environmental issues and sustainability?
If they are about good news or hopeful new technology
Do you enjoy reading articles about history and historical events?
Very much
Do you enjoy reading articles about psychology and human behavior?
Usually, sometimes I'm not interested in the topic
Do you enjoy reading articles about fashion trends and style advice?
No, but sometimes I look at the pictures
Do you enjoy reading articles about education and learning strategies?
Of course, I am a tutor!
Do you enjoy reading articles about home improvement and interior design?
No, but sometimes I look at the pictures
Do you enjoy reading articles about movies, television shows, and entertainment news?
Only if it's a piece of media I'm really interested in
Do you enjoy reading articles about personal development and self-improvement?
Yes
Do you enjoy reading articles about space exploration and astronomy?
Oh yeah, space is so cool!
Do you enjoy reading articles about gardening and plant care?
No, but one day I will get more into it
Do you enjoy reading articles about animal behavior and wildlife conservation?
Sometimes
Do you enjoy reading articles about music, including reviews, artist profiles, and industry news?
Not really
Do you enjoy reading articles about philosophy and different philosophical theories?
I do, but not if I'm really tired
Do you enjoy reading articles about advancements in artificial intelligence and robotics?
Honestly, not much
Do you enjoy reading articles about outdoor activities and adventure sports?
Only if I'm planning to hang otu with friends and need some ideas

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Good news! I'm happy! I feel like I got the gist from the description

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Bon Appetit
Title: Bon Appetit's Best Banana Bread Recipe
Description: After baking 14 loaves, we aligned on this tender, ultra-moist banana bread as our collective favorite.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: National Geographic
Title: There’s a new way to tour the Amazon rainforest: by crane
Description: Canopy cranes, once reserved for treetop research, let you see the “eighth continent” like an arbornaut.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I am interested in this as a less invasive way to see the Amazon! I hope at least!

Description: Meditation teacher Sharon Salzberg discusses how our yearning for happiness can support us in our journey toward freedom—and why we tend to search for it in the wrong places.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I'll at least check it out

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative yes/no question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the yes/no question and nothing else:
